TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit QueryExpression extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Retrieves instances of a specific entity type by using a complex query.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Data source controls that derive from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IQueryableDataSource> expose the data source query that enables you to create LINQ queries declaratively. You can create new expressions by deriving from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.DataSourceExpression>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes new instance of the class.
Gets the collection of expressions in the query.
Docs.value: The collection of expressions in the query.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Linq.IQueryable GetQueryable(class System.Linq.IQueryable source) cil managed

Docs.param: The data source control to use.
Docs.summary: Resolves the expression by using the specified <xref:System.Linq.IQueryable> data source control.
Docs.returns: An instance of the data source control that was used to resolve the expression.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetQueryable method uses the specified <xref:System.Linq.IQueryable> object to resolve the expression.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Initialize (System.Web.UI.Control owner, System.Web.HttpContext context, System.Web.UI.WebControls.IQueryableDataSource dataSource);

Docs.summary: Initializes the object by using the specified owner control, a instance, and object.
